Reviews.Title: “Unreliable”
Reviews.Author: Toyga
Reviews.Content: We paid for 4 nights cost but they said that you are lying and you paid for 3 nights.They wanted us leave hotel or pay 1 more night cost

Reviews.Title: “Best value in town for a single room !”
Reviews.Author: Photogallery1
Reviews.Content: I have just spent 7 nights at the Hotel Groenendael and I really like it. Of course it is not "perfect"...but you can't expect "luxury" for 35euro a night, breakfast included ! a great DEAL in Amsterdam! I had the very decent room n.11 on the last floor, a bit old, but perfectly clean and silent, with a little sink inside the room. The Hotel is perfectly situated in the historic center so I never had to take the public transports, and is just 5mn walking from the train station so it is easy to reach. The breakfast was always with very fresh bread and tasty jam. The staff was very helpful, welcoming, easygoing, funny dutch humor, and helped me organize a day trip outside of the city to see the tulips fields, or to check hours of openings of the main museums. I loved the city, its architecture and its museums and will certainly go back, and will definitely stay at Groenendael.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly maintained, animal guests, unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: cehawe
Reviews.Content: 60 Euros a night for a double/twin room incl breakfast. Place looked alright only in the first place.. old dirty curtains, shower on our floor not working, obviously only the most necessary repairs and maintenence is being done. Bed sheets were clean but had holes. At night we woke up from the noises of our animal guests: a mouse was trying to have her share of our food.. :( The next morning, the owner and his co-worker reacted almost aggressive when being confronted with the problem. Supposedly everybody has the problem in Amsterdam, and it cannot be solved.. we left and went to another hotel down the street, and for the same money we got a nice clean room, working shower, nice staff and a decent breakfast. Conclusion: I wouldn't go there again, but hey, better than staying in Hotel Kabul.. :) If you need a good reason to leave early (maybe to get out of the 2 night minimum stay), just mention that you had mice in your room and enjoy the show! :D

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: paolopoggi
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here every time i have stayed in Amsterdam, since the late 1980s. It is a no nonsense hotel with a good hearty breakfast and a convenient location for train station, and the city centre. The hotel is, in itself, a museum of travellers past, and gives one an immediate sense of what Amsterdam life is all about. I love this place, and all my friends who have visited it still talk about it today. Give it a try, but if you want luxury, try somewhere else. P.S. My missus would not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Tattered and torn !”
Reviews.Author: Oldwarrior
Reviews.Content: I was seeking an economy hotel and I got one but I was not prepared to find a bed with a mattress which was 6" lower in the middle than on the sides as well as at the head and foot. Lying in it made you "V" shaped. They changed it upon demand but there are torn and stained carpets in the vesitibule and on the stairwells (there is no elevator), a large cracked ceiling height mirror in the lobby which they lamely attempt to hide with a plastic shrub. In our room there was a mirror door over one closet and it had been cracked and the crack covered over with masking tape and the entire door was just missing from the other closet. The bathroom door had two tennis ball sized indentations, breaks through the door skin actually but you could'nt see through them and then they only came in and cleaned once during our 5 night stay. When I asked them to clean they would smile and shrug and say "Yes" and you could see they did'nt understand you. I don't believe that there are any Dutch working here. On the positive side it is very well located, for example only 900 feet from Rembrandts house and perhaps 1500' from the Floating Flower Market. I had requested a room at the front which had great views of the small canal out front. I saw many, many tourists taking photos of this canal-street as there is an old church (1634) at the end of the canal and a 400 year old drawbridge over this picturesque canal. On two nights there was a little partying out on the street below but we were so tired from walking and touring that we drifted off to sleep quickly anyway. If you go here,I would ask for a front room or a room at the very rear...specify a room with windows as I believe that more than half of the rooms are tiny inside rooms with no windows..our room was large (#11).This was when built 400 years ago a single family dwelling, narrow and the stairs are steep. Would I go here again ? I don't think so but it is listed as a budget hotel so maybe I should'nt be complaining. I got a low price hotel.Next time I'll pay for something better and I saw a LOT of hotels this size and in good shape all over Amsterdam and I covered the city on foot very thoroughly.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty room, and all my clothes were stolen!”
Reviews.Author: whitneylee
Reviews.Content: This was, by far, the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. As soon as I walked into the room, I wanted to leave. The carpet and walls were stained, and the whole room was very dingy. I suggested to my husband that we should leave, but, although he felt similarly about the room, he felt that we had an obligation to stay, since we had made reservations. Also, he didn't want to walk the streets of Amsterdam looking for a hotel room. Unfortunately, he convinced me to stay, but only after I inspected the sheets and saw that they were clean. When we got back that first night, we noticed that both of our backpacks were missing!!! All of my clothes were gone, and we still had 2 more days to go! I don't know how they got in, since we were on the 3rd floor, and we were so close to the next building that a person could not fit between them. Our door had not been tampered with. This made me think that perhaps the staff at the hotel had something to do with it, but the owner gave us our money back for the next 2 days (my husband finally decided to go somewhere else!), which convinced me that he had nothing to do with it. Another bad thing about the hotel is its location--right in the most touristy area in Amsterdam. Also, the bathroom was right outside the door, and since the walls were so thin I could hear everything going on in there. Nasty!! I miss my cat shirt.

Reviews.Title: “fine but some rooms noisy”
Reviews.Author: suuzinSF
Reviews.Content: This is a fine budget hotel and breakfast was good, staff very friendly. But ask for a room in the back and not facing the street... it may be smaller but MUCH quieter. The hotel is convenient to the train station but the street can be a bit noisy with some rowdies yelling at night, street cleaners, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Not as it looks”
Reviews.Author: elandros
Reviews.Content: the ambient looks cosy but..pay attention: under the covers and in the covers lay acari, under the beds sometimes you can find a mouse and you aren't given a receipt for the payment when you leave-at least, this is what happened to us. the rooms are never cleaned and if you suffer from allergies that's not the right place. the nice cat, Sushi, isn't enough to make it a good place, and 30 Euros per person in a triple room are really too much.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Cykelley
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Hotel Groenendael for 7 nights in April 2005. I had reservations about staying at such a budget hotel. However by the end of the stay my reservations were gone. We stayed in room #9, I reccomend this room to anyone who chooses this hotel. It has a private shower and three huge European style windows that fully open up to the pedestrian street below. We had lots of natual light and it was great to be able to watch the happenings below! The street noise was a bit loud at times, espesially when the garbage truck comes through, but we slept with the windows open so it was louder to us than usual. The breakfast that is included is a typical Dutch budget hotel breakfast, hard boiled egg, bread, cheese, jam, coffe and tea. Overall I don't think you could find a better deal in Amsterdam. Clean room, private shower, plenty of clean shared toilets in the hall, great location, all for only 55 euro a night.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Groenendael
HotelInfo.Address: Nieuwendijk 15, Amsterdam 1012 LZ, The Netherlands
